website_summaries.verdict: This reasonably priced feeder is perfect for drawing larger butterflies to your garden, and it's packed with features.
pros: At 11" in diameter, this model can accommodate large butterflies better than many others
There’s room for fruit, and wicks are easily replaceable
The feeder hangs securely from the included hook
It’s safe in the dishwasher and has a cup to catch ants
cons: The wicks get moldy in wet spring weather and summer heat, and bees and wasps can easily get to the nectar

customer_reviews.title: Bunches of Butterflies
customer_reviews.text: Today three painted lady butterflies swarmed it, and all day I have had dozens!!!!So yes it does work, and I have three different feeders and this one seems to be the favorite.
customer_reviews.author: SuZckTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Love the large size
customer_reviews.text: Have to scuff up the plastic with sandpaper so butterflies can get their footing, which is typical of every butterfly feeder I've had. Love the large size, makes it more inviting for the larger Monarch butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei B. Stierlen

customer_reviews.title: The butterflies have landed!
customer_reviews.text: The butterflies seem to love the fruit corners more than the juice. I have seen a lot of different butterflies looking out my window feeding from this product. Pineapple has been the biggest hit so far.
customer_reviews.author: Renee T.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept but no butterfies ever used it. Horrible idea on the hook they provide that screws into center. When breezy it just slides everywhere, is not sturdy. But the worst thing is trying to keep the ropes clean for their sugar source and after using it once the screw broke the plastic off in a chunk as I was screwing hook back on. Due to this defect or bad design I will be returning it and not buying another. Overall, they need to at the very least change the hook assembly to a more sturdy, durable design to hang like all my other feeders have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful with this product and have a huge pollinator garden. I had notices many of the insects were headed to my hummingbird feeders so I purchased this for them. NO ONE CAME. Same food, same solutions etc but nothing came to this feeder and it was a waste of money, you are better off filling up a few puddles and planting more nectar plants.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Pittman

customer_reviews.title: Bad for butterflies
customer_reviews.text: No butterflies used this - they prefer flowers 1000%. The fabric threads got moldy very quickly. Not sure its good to feed out of plastic which may leach and cause delicate butterflies more harm than good.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Effective ant deterrent
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get butterflies first week near the house. Moved it to sunny yard today so will see how it does. BUT I think the built-in ant-guard works. As I took down one without an ant trap and put this one up in its place, the ants on the way up the pole immediately turned around to descend - before my very eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BUTTERFLYS
customer_reviews.text: Never saw a butterfly on or even near it. The only thing it attracted was wasps - not even honey bees which would have salvaged purchasing it. It's hard to keep clean, the wicks keep getting moldy. It was a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: HappyTrader

customer_reviews.title: Only attracts bees and ants
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. It does not attract butterflies, only bees and ants. I had a swallowtail bouncing from flower to flower for 5 minutes and it never showed any interest in this "feeder". A week later nothing but bees and ants!
customer_reviews.author: Cherri Norris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fill and clean.
customer_reviews.text: easy to fill and clean. Birds love it. There are not to many butterflies use it but I am in Phoenix, AZ may be to hot at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Anita H. Robeson

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies don’t use it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine up for about a month and a half. I change it every 3-4 days when I change my hummingbird feeders and have never had butterflies use it. It only attracts wasps and bees. We have butterflies at our house, they just don’t use it. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Belle

customer_reviews.title: Forget butterflies should be an ant house!
customer_reviews.text: This should be called an ant attractor! My entire bird feeder pole had ants up and down after I hung this! I just bagged it up and threw it away! What a waste of $$$$...
customer_reviews.author: Nicole LaVeglia

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but only 1 butterfly as of now
customer_reviews.text: great concept, but have only seen 1 butterfly in the area
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Never attracted any butterflies. It became moldy easy! Swarmed by ants and wasps. Will use our regular hummingbird feeders from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for my mom. She has it hanging in her garden. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kimerly Coyne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Trying to encourage the monarch population. I’ve never had one of these, can’t wait until summer.
customer_reviews.author: Lnicker1

customer_reviews.title: Bees and Wasps take it over.
customer_reviews.text: There so many bees and wasps on the wicks that the Butterflies can't get to the wicks. Looks like a Bee hive.
customer_reviews.author: Valaen Clapsaddle

customer_reviews.title: wow beautiful guest to dinner
customer_reviews.text: I love butterflies. So this is the perfect 👌 gift to myself!!!
customer_reviews.author: karen f.

customer_reviews.title: Bee feeder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for butterflies but better serves as a feeder for honeybees swarms attracted to it not that I mind I think it’s a great
customer_reviews.author: Richard Layman

customer_reviews.title: I am the first to have a Butterfly Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift, and she loved it,,, can use both fruit and the nectar packet. She can't wait to try it out and see if it works
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Buzzell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: IT IS GREAT BUT THE BEES AND ANTS TOOK IT OVER
customer_reviews.author: Ted Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly Feeder
customer_reviews.text: It attracts ants! The wicks work well and it's easy to use, however, I took it down since it fed more ants than butterflies!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Love the Butterfly feeder
customer_reviews.text: Love the Butterfly feeder. Purchased one for myself and one for my daughter for Christmas. Can't wait to put them out in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon H.

customer_reviews.title: Never worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: This product had high ratings so I purchased it. We have many butterflies in our area. I followed all the instructions, used the correct food, BUT no butterflies went near the feeder. They did go to flowers right next to the feeder, etc. The bees however loved this feeder. I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome feeder I bought it for the ladybugs but it became a bee feeder not upset about that perfect for pollinating my plants. The hook is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Dunlevy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but the hardware needs to be improved to stainless steel.
customer_reviews.text: I put this up with nectar and banana pieces, fruit goes bad way to fast outside in the heat. The wicks do get moldy but I bought a length at my local store and cut new ones when these et moldy. ID give it 5 stars if they’d have used Stainless steel hardware, the nut is in the moat and it got rusty right away so one star off for that. Easy to clean and maintain just don’t know how long it will last with a steel nut and hanger. I’d take another 1/2 star off for price, all of these are way over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jon V. Theisen

customer_reviews.title: Bees love it
customer_reviews.text: I use mine as a bee feeder. It works great, but I had to replace the wicks within the first week due to getting moldy, and can not find the wicks it came with as replacement so I used thick shoe laces. These have worked better and last a lot longer. The bees love this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Lori E

customer_reviews.title: It's nice but does nothing to attract butterflies
customer_reviews.text: I have tried using this on several different occasions, because I was determined to like this feeder and give it a chance to work. I have put it out before flowers were in bloom, during bloom and at the end of the season when butterflies should be having a hard time finding food. Nothing attracted them. In fact, they would land on flowers next to the feeder, but never the feeder. And, like others have reported, the wick constantly get moldy.
customer_reviews.author: WDC5440

customer_reviews.title: Unusable. Attracts everything but butterflies
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a butterfly feeder locally and found this particular one at my hardware store. After setting it up I never saw one butterfly feeding from it. Instead, it did nothing but attract wasps. Then to add insult to injury I found out I could have bought it a lot cheaper online. A waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: It also attracts wasps!
customer_reviews.text: I have only seen wasps, no butterflies on my feeder. I have had to take it down. No more feeder.
customer_reviews.author: C. Webb

product_meta.title: Woodlink NABFLY Audubon Classic Butterfly Feeder
product_meta.description: Woodlink NABFLY Audubon Classic Butterfly Feeder
feature_bullets: Multiple feeding ports plus four fruit dishes

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars62 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
